steps.text: Beat together the egg yolks and sugar until light and thick.
Heat milk, heavy cream, vanilla pod, vanilla pulp, and salt in a heavy saucepan over medium heat.
Heat until bubbles begin to form around the edges. Remove from heat.
Take 1/2 a cup of the hot milk mixture and slowly whisk it into the egg mixture.
Slowly whisk the hot egg mixture into the saucepan.
Cook over low heat, stirring continuously until mixture thickens (8-10 minutes).
Strain through a fine mesh sieve into a metal bowl and refrigerate until cold (6-8 hours).
When mixture has cooled to around 40 degrees F, pour into an ice cream machine.
Allow to churn for 20-25 minutes, or until gelato reaches desired consistency.
If a firmer consistency is desire, place in the freezer for about 2 hours.
Remove from freezer 10 minutes prior to serving.
